contest-event.event-date: Oct. 11, 1975 D National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) 1 Test Piece Contest National Championship of Great Britain (Finals) national-finals-championship-section European Championships The current Nationals contest began in 1900, but there was a previous 'Nationals' contest run 40 years earlier: Enderby Jackson's Great National Contest. Championship Un Vie de Matelot (A Sailor's Life) Royal Albert Hall, Kensington, Kensington and Chelsea, Greater London, England, UK Prizes: First: 500 Second: 200 Third: 100 Fourth: 75 The winning conductor received a presentation score of the test piece. Two presentations were made to Peter McNab of Black Dyke and Arnold Hall of Fairey Engineering Bands. May 18, 2010, 3:54 p.m. Oct. 14, 2011, 5:17 p.m. 1 Black Dyke Band Peter Parkes 2 Sun Life Walter B. Hargreaves 3 Brighouse and Rastrick Band James Scott 4 Yorkshire Imperial Brass Band Trevor Walmsley 5 Fairey Band Kenneth Dennison 6 Thoresby Colliery William Lippeatt 7 Reg Vardy Band George Thompson 8 Hammonds Saltaire Geoffrey Whitham 9 Jaguar Cars (City of Coventry) Albert Chappell 9 City of Manchester Derek Garside 11 Cory Band Arthur Kenney 12 Unison Kinneil Band Alex Fleming 12 Morris Motors Band Walter Rees 14 Wingates Band Richard Evans 14 John Laing (Hendon) Band Donald Morrison 16 Woodfalls Band Courtney Bosanko 16 Whitburn Band Derek Broadbent 18 Westoe Band Ray White 19 Parc and Dare Band Ieuan Morgan 19 Markham and District Band Don Hendy
